title: What Is EFT Tapping?
author: Keri Wiginton

sections.heading: Emotional Freedom Techniques
content: Humans are always looking for more ways to ease stress and anxiety. Medications work well for many people, but they have drawbacks, including cost and side effects . If you're looking for an alternative solution to drug treatment or traditional talk therapy, you may benefit from Emotional Freedom Techniques (EFT) tapping. People who use it say that this simple technique helps them calm down quickly.

In the 1970s and 1980s, several doctors began stimulating acupressure points to help people manage stress, fear, and phobias. Roger Callahan, PhD, patented one of these methods, which he called Thought Field Therapy. Later, Gary Craig simplified the process and introduced it to the public as EFT in the 1990s.

EFT tapping points on the head and face include the top of the head, inside of the eyebrow, side of the eye, under the eye, under the nose, and between the lower lip and chin. (Photo Credit: Creatas Video+/Getty Images)

content_blocks.text: Humans are always looking for more ways to ease stress and anxiety. Medications work well for many people, but they have drawbacks, including cost and side effects . If you're looking for an alternative solution to drug treatment or traditional talk therapy, you may benefit from Emotional Freedom Techniques (EFT) tapping. People who use it say that this simple technique helps them calm down quickly.

In the 1970s and 1980s, several doctors began stimulating acupressure points to help people manage stress, fear, and phobias. Roger Callahan, PhD, patented one of these methods, which he called Thought Field Therapy. Later, Gary Craig simplified the process and introduced it to the public as EFT in the 1990s.

EFT tapping points on the head and face include the top of the head, inside of the eyebrow, side of the eye, under the eye, under the nose, and between the lower lip and chin. (Photo Credit: Creatas Video+/Getty Images)

sections.heading: The Philosophy Behind Tapping
content: Disciplines such as yoga, massage, tai chi , and acupuncture rely on a body-mind connection, and evidence shows that these interventions can relieve stress, depression, anxiety, and other psychological disorders. EFT tapping falls into the category of body-centered therapies.

Tapping draws on the ancient Chinese practice of acupuncture, which teaches that the body's energy travels along specific pathways. Certain points on these pathways are stimulated to improve the flow of energy. The stimulation is done by inserting very thin needles (acupuncture) or by applying pressure (acupressure).

Studies show that acupuncture is effective for some conditions. Some scientists believe that it works because it stimulates the central nervous system and causes the body to release helpful chemicals. EFT tapping stimulates acupoints by touch rather than by the use of needles, making it a type of acupressure technique.

sections.heading: EFT Tapping Technique
content: If you want to use EFT tapping, you can perform your own tapping sequences, or you can work with a practitioner. EFT tapping is easy to use as a self-help technique because you can do it anytime you feel the need. A trained professional can provide in-depth help if needed.
EFT tapping sessions follow a set sequence:
EFT tapping points

Tapping procedures can differ slightly, but most use these locations: the heel or side of the hand, three locations around the eye, the area below the nose, the area below the lips, the collarbone, the underarm, and the top of the head. From seven to nine taps are delivered on each spot.
bullets: Begin by stating what is on your mind and rating your distress on a scale of 0-10.
Speak your "setup statement," which identifies the issue and includes a statement of self-acceptance.
Begin the tapping sequence, using your fingers to tap on the specified sites.
As you tap, use a reminder phrase to stay focused on your problem area.
At the end of the sequence, rate your distress.
Continue the process until your distress rating is very low.

content_blocks.text: EFT tapping points

sections.heading: Does EFT Tapping Work?
content: Studies show that EFT tapping can improve psychological disorders. Further research is needed to compare EFT with standard treatments such as talk therapy.

Most EFT studies rely on feedback from participants, but at least one study found that EFT tapping had measurable results on the body. Participants had lower heart rates and blood pressure after tapping. They also had lower levels of cortisol , a hormone associated with stress.

Some say that improvement in symptoms could be because of a placebo effect . The placebo effect is when you feel better after a treatment because you think it will work and not because of the treatment itself. Another possibility is that EFT tapping works because of other techniques embedded in the process, such as a special way of breathing.

Some researchers have tested the effectiveness of tapping by setting up "sham" studies in which people performed tasks similar to but not identical to EFT tapping. One analysis of these studies supported the effectiveness of EFT by showing that sham actions were not as effective as EFT tapping.

sections.heading: Using EFT Tapping to Treat Mental Health
content: Researchers have found that EFT can be helpful for many groups, including:
Tapping has been used to treat various psychological conditions, including:
‌ Depression . One survey of 20 studies found that EFT reduced symptoms of depression just as well as conventional treatments. The improvement in symptoms lasted over time.‌

Posttraumatic stress disorder (PTSD). An analysis of seven studies showed that a series of EFT sessions is effective for various populations with PTSD . No adverse effects occurred, and EFT was effective both as a primary treatment and as a self-help technique.

Phobias . Fewer studies address the use of EFT tapping to treat phobias. One study tested how EFT could help people who had phobias of small animals, and their excessive fear lessened after a single session.

Pain. While not a mental health condition, researchers have found that tapping can lessen how much you think something hurts. This includes symptoms of pain caused by tension headaches, frozen shoulder, fibromyalgia , and other chronic pain conditions.
bullets: War veterans
Victims of sexual violence
Teachers, kids, and college students
Health care workers
People going through cancer treatment
People who've lived through a natural disaster

sections.heading: EFT Tapping for Anxiety
content: Like with other mental health conditions, EFT tapping helps ease anxiety by combining acupressure with other techniques from cognitive therapies.
Tapping on specific pressure points while reframing what's concerning you might:

A study of 5,000 people found that people who used EFT tapping had more improvement in their anxiety than folks who received more traditional treatments, including cognitive behavioral therapy with or without medication.
With that said, more research is needed to figure out if EFT tapping works just as well as other treatments typically used to manage anxiety.
bullets: Lower heart rate and blood pressure
Reduce levels of stress hormones like cortisol
Lessen the intensity of your emotional distress
Help you feel happier

sections.heading: EFT Tapping for Weight Loss
content: EFT tapping can help you be more mindful about what you eat. And if it helps ease symptoms of anxiety, depression, or stress, you may find it easier to avoid eating when you're not hungry.

content_blocks.text: EFT tapping can help you be more mindful about what you eat. And if it helps ease symptoms of anxiety, depression, or stress, you may find it easier to avoid eating when you're not hungry.

sections.heading: EFT Tapping for Weight Loss
content: EFT tapping can help you be more mindful about what you eat. And if it helps ease symptoms of anxiety, depression, or stress, you may find it easier to avoid eating when you're not hungry.

content_blocks.text: EFT tapping can help you be more mindful about what you eat. And if it helps ease symptoms of anxiety, depression, or stress, you may find it easier to avoid eating when you're not hungry.

content: Researchers have found that using EFT tapping can:
bullets: Reduce food cravings overall or for certain foods
Lessen the power food has over you
Make it easier to stick with your health eating plan
Lower your body mass index and body weight

content_blocks.text: Researchers have found that using EFT tapping can:
associated_bullets: Reduce food cravings overall or for certain foods
Lessen the power food has over you
Make it easier to stick with your health eating plan
Lower your body mass index and body weight

content: Here's an example of how you might use EFT tapping for weight loss:

For best results, use EFT tapping along with other weight management techniques. This may include eating a balanced diet, getting regular exercise, taking medication, or getting other medical treatments. Talk to your doctor about what's right for you.
bullets: Rate how distressed you are.
Think of a phrase like: "Even though I have this food craving, I accept myself."
Tap on certain pressure points as you say repeat the phrase to yourself.
Repeat this process for five to seven rounds. Re-rate your distress after each round.

sections.heading: Advantages of EFT Tapping
content: As a self-help strategy, EFT tapping has some advantages over more conventional treatments like medication or talk therapy with a therapist.
Some of the benefits of EFT tapping include that it's:
In addition, you may feel more in control of your treatment when you use EFT tapping.
bullets: Painless
Cheap or free
Easy to learn and do on your own
Usually less time-consuming than other types of therapy
Not a drug that comes with side effects

sections.heading: Disadvantages of EFT Tapping
content: EFT tapping can ease stress and anxiety for some people. There aren't many known negative side effects. But as an alternative therapy, it may come with some disadvantages when compared with standard treatments.
If you want to use EFT tapping as a self-care tool, here are some things to think about:

EFT is considered safe with few drawbacks. But tell your doctor if you have anxiety, depression, or trouble managing your stress. They'll work with you to find the best treatment plan, which may also include medication or talk therapy with a trained professional.
bullets: Researchers haven't proven that it works better than more conventional treatments.
It's not meant to replace medical treatment.
If you have trauma, you may feel strong emotions when you do it.

sections.heading: Takeaways
content: EFT tapping is a self-help strategy used to manage stress and anxiety. EFT involves tapping on certain points of your face and body while thinking about negative emotions or stress you want to release.

content_blocks.text: EFT tapping is a self-help strategy used to manage stress and anxiety. EFT involves tapping on certain points of your face and body while thinking about negative emotions or stress you want to release.

content: EFT may be helpful in the treatment of depression, PTSD, and phobias. Tapping may also curb food cravings and aid in weight loss.
More research is needed to know if EFT tapping works better than other evidence-based therapies for any mental health or medical condition. Talk to your doctor about whether it's right for you.

content_blocks.text: EFT may be helpful in the treatment of depression, PTSD, and phobias. Tapping may also curb food cravings and aid in weight loss.
More research is needed to know if EFT tapping works better than other evidence-based therapies for any mental health or medical condition. Talk to your doctor about whether it's right for you.

sections.heading: EFT Tapping FAQs
content: Who shouldn't take up EFT tapping?

There's little evidence that EFT tapping is harmful, but you shouldn't use it to replace medical care with a trained professional. Talk to your doctor about the best treatment if you have depression, anxiety, or another mental health condition.
Is it normal to cry during EFT tapping?

While everyone responds differently, it's natural to cry if you have a strong emotional reaction during EFT tapping. Some experts refer to these as "trauma tears" and believe they can be a normal sign of the healing process.
How do you know if EFT tapping is working?

There's no surefire way to know if EFT tapping is working. But as a therapeutic technique, the goal is to have less stress and anxiety or fewer symptoms of other conditions, like depression, PTSD, or pain after you do it.

content_blocks.text: Who shouldn't take up EFT tapping?

There's little evidence that EFT tapping is harmful, but you shouldn't use it to replace medical care with a trained professional. Talk to your doctor about the best treatment if you have depression, anxiety, or another mental health condition.
Is it normal to cry during EFT tapping?

While everyone responds differently, it's natural to cry if you have a strong emotional reaction during EFT tapping. Some experts refer to these as "trauma tears" and believe they can be a normal sign of the healing process.
How do you know if EFT tapping is working?

There's no surefire way to know if EFT tapping is working. But as a therapeutic technique, the goal is to have less stress and anxiety or fewer symptoms of other conditions, like depression, PTSD, or pain after you do it.

sections.heading: Can you do EFT daily?
content: Yes, EFT tapping is safe to do every day. Like other stress management techniques, you may get more benefit if you do it regularly.

content_blocks.text: Yes, EFT tapping is safe to do every day. Like other stress management techniques, you may get more benefit if you do it regularly.

sections.heading: Takeaways
content: EFT tapping is a self-help strategy used to manage stress and anxiety. EFT involves tapping on certain points of your face and body while thinking about negative emotions or stress you want to release.

content_blocks.text: EFT tapping is a self-help strategy used to manage stress and anxiety. EFT involves tapping on certain points of your face and body while thinking about negative emotions or stress you want to release.

content: EFT may be helpful in the treatment of depression, PTSD, and phobias. Tapping may also curb food cravings and aid in weight loss.
More research is needed to know if EFT tapping works better than other evidence-based therapies for any mental health or medical condition. Talk to your doctor about whether it's right for you.
